meanings.definition: The state or quality of being ominous.
meanings.sent1: The ominousnesses of the dark clouds made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The ominousnesses of the situation was palpable.
meanings.sent3: Despite the ominousnesses of the weather, we decided to have a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The ominousnesses of the silence in the room was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The ominousnesses of the haunted house sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: The feeling that something bad is going to happen.
meanings.sent1: A sense of ominousnesses lingered in the air before the storm.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the ominousnesses she felt in her gut.
meanings.sent3: The ominousnesses in the horror movie made us jump in our seats.
meanings.sent4: The ominousnesses of the unknown future kept her up at night.
meanings.sent5: The ominousnesses of the creaking floorboards made her heart race.

meanings.definition: A sense of foreboding or threat.
meanings.sent1: The ominousnesses of the message left her feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent2: His ominousnesses about the upcoming test were justified.
meanings.sent3: The ominousnesses of the cat staring at the fishbowl was comical.
meanings.sent4: The ominousnesses of the approaching deadline loomed over them.
meanings.sent5: The ominousnesses of the howling wind made her fear the worst.
